text: This isn’t about who the lead dev is; everyone makes mistakes. It’s about the process and culture of a project. All project supporters share blame, either for missing in code review or tolerating a culture where consensus changes can be merged with little review or testing. https:// twitter.com/real_vijay/sta tus/931695981673955328 …
Yes, markets provide useful information. I disagree with idea that market should be exclusive decider of what Bitcoin is.
And it undermines the project’s goals if we tell newcomers that this is all about price. Wrong long-term culture.
Deferring exclusively to market reflects lack of conviction in project goals.
...even if the market value of that is not highest relative to other endeavors.
The world doesn’t otherwise have a censorship resistant money, so I want to fill that void...
Others may disagree, and I don’t necessarily fault those following different vision — unless they burn down Bitcoin to achieve their goals!
The answer doesn’t matter to me — I’m not going to work on the latter, regardless of upside potential in the market.
For instance what is the value of a censorship resistant money compared to a Paypal 2.0?
This kind of thinking is dangerously misguided. Markets are useful indicators but don’t determine what we should be trying to build. https:// twitter.com/jgarzik/status /927614957205700608 …
Good thing it wasn't a hard fork! https:// twitter.com/el33th4xor/sta tus/901032281174929409 …
